page.title: 04HOUSING IN BUCKHURST HILL
page.content: Our block is very much a suburb of London.There is no break between Buckhurst Hill and Woodford ,they just merge together.This is typical of London suburbs .There is a break between Buckurst & Chigwell caused by the valley of the R. Roding & the M11. Here there is little housing as it is mostly wasteland.The block is not a cheap place to live.The average cost of a house is Â£100,000. Council housing is limited and in short supply . Most of the houses are detached with big gardens . The area is still developing. One of the things locals have noticed is the amount of new housing. The area has a number of old houses with large grounds. These are redeveloped with builders sqeezing on smaller houses. This is the only way there can be any new building as we are in the Green Belt.
